feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 5:21PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MOOSE GLACIER DAMMED LAKE IS RELEASING AND COULD CAUSE HIGH WATER IN KENAI LAKE AND COOPER LANDING AREA... WHAT: There is reason to believe the Moose Glacier dammed lake (GDP) has begun releasing. WHERE: Biggest impacts at Snow River leading into Kenai Lake and Cooper Landing area.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 2:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...CONFIDENCE INCREASING FOR HEAVY RAIN THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT... A front over the eastern Gulf of Alaska will stall on the outer coast this evening. A second front with atmospheric river characteristics will merge with the first and shift west before stalling once again, this time over the northeast Gulf Coast. Heaviest rain totals through Friday night will be located over
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Yakutat; Glacier Bay

entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN NORTHUMBERLAND AND EAST CENTRAL RICHMOND COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM EDT... At 907 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Heathsville, or near Callao, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 07 at 7:51PM EDT until September 07 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Chesterfield County in central Virginia... Central Henrico County in central Virginia... The City of Richmond in central Virginia... * Until 1100 PM EDT.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 07 at 7:48PM EDT until September 07 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Hanover County in central Virginia... Northwestern King and Queen County in east central Virginia... Northwestern King William County in east central Virginia... * Until 1100 PM EDT.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Hanover; King William; King and Queen

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 9:21PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Rutland and northwestern Windsor Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 920 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rutland, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 9:11PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Essex and northern Addison Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 910 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mount Marcy to near Moriah. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 8:59PM EDT until September 07 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Berkshire County in western Massachusetts... Northeastern Columbia County in east central New York... Southeastern Washington County in east central New York... Rensselaer County in east central New York...

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 07 at 4:30AM CDT until September 07 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Minnesota Park Point and Wisconsin Point Beaches. * WHEN...Through this evening.
